summary: Completed comprehensive frontend testing of Valentine invitation app for 'Koco'. All core features implemented correctly with simplified 3-state flow (landing -> paper -> success). Testing confirmed direct envelope-to-paper transition, proper button placement, and dodge functionality.

ui_bugs.issue: Animation causes element instability during automated testing
ui_bugs.symptoms: Playwright reports 'element is not stable' due to continuous y/rotate animations
ui_bugs.workaround: Force click (force=True) bypasses the issue successfully
ui_bugs.impact: Does not affect user experience, only automated testing

passed_tests: Landing page loads with realistic teddy bear image
Envelope overlay displays 'Click me' text correctly
Envelope click transitions DIRECTLY to paper (no intermediate screen)
Paper displays correct question text: 'Koco, my love, will you be my Valentine?'
Yes/No buttons are positioned ON the paper below the question
Placeholder image area positioned BELOW the Yes/No buttons
No button dodges on hover/touch with 'Nice try ðŸ˜Œ' message
Yes button triggers confetti animation and success screen
Success screen shows 'Yay!' and 'Happy Valentine's, Koco' messages
Mobile responsiveness works correctly across all screens
Skip button provides alternative navigation path
Save functionality available on success screen
action_item_for_main_agent: Consider reducing envelope animation intensity (reduce y-axis movement or rotation frequency) to improve automated testing stability. Current implementation works perfectly for users but may cause issues with future automated testing.
